result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanton J. Meschefske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $400.00 is to be paid by June 15, 2016.  If restitution is not paid, the court orders a conditional jail term of 30 days.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim.  This has been done and been approved by the district attorney.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stanton J. Meschefske

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stanton J. Meschefske in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.    Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty.   Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution in the amount of $400.00 plus restitution surcharge; letter of apology due to victim which has been done; conditional jail term of 30 days; if restitution is paid by June 15, 2016 defendant will not have to serve conditional jail term of 30 days.  - rt

Prior: 115 Broadway Ave, Wausau, WI 54403 United States
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Stanton J. Meschefske in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not have an attorney.  Court questionned defendant regarding his attempts to get an attorney.  Defendant indicated that he will accept the State's offer.  Court will schedule this for a plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  - rt

Defendant Stanton J. Meschefske in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Court questions Mr. Meschefske.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting that the bond be continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:45 am.  - rt

Defendant Stanton J. Meschefske not in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  It is now 4:09 pm Stanton Meschefske does not appear.   The court is ordering a body only bench warrant based on his nonappearance.  - rt

Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with M.M. C. - dob:  5-12-56.
